title: Should I main Nami?
body:
This is my first ever post on the boards, and I am pretty new, only level 10.  I want to decide my main early, and I found {{champion:267}}Nami really fun to play as (but she is pretty hard to play as) and she really suited my play style, mostly magic, second attack, last defense. And her abilities cover pretty much any magic ability I think I would need, Bubble to stun and to attack multiple enemies, Ebb and Flow to deal nice damage and heal, Tidecaller's Blessing to increase my own or a teammate's attack and Tidal Wave pretty much to deal damage and slow any enemies and heal all allies in front of me.

But some people say she is bad, hardly ever used (which is actually true, but I like using a uncommon class, or in this case, champion) and can't land Bubble or Tidal Wave. What should I do? Should I main her or should I keep looking for a good support (I want to be a support class)? I enjoy a challenge too, and maybe if I get good enough at her, I can do beat a lot of champions. I know, I can change whenever I want, but I want to get pretty good with one champion as soon as possible so I can get good at the game itself. Thank you for helping me on this decision. :)

you should try and play whatever you like, as long as you get good enough to play it ... **what "some people say" is irrelevant if you can hold your part of the deal within the game** ... 

for example I play malphite support (which most people say that sucks) and sejuani support (which noone believes that it is even a valid pick and call it borderline trollpick), but I make them work within the level of play that I belong ... I even dabble with galio support (in ranked) or even irelia support (in normals) ... 

are they meta picks .?. No ...
do other people say they are at least good picks .?. No ... 
but do they work .?. **Yes, and that is what counts** ... 

so, by all means, main nami ... it is a champion that can get you quite far if you master her, so why not .?. :)

Hey there!

I have mained nami from b3-p1. This season/last season. 

I think a lot of people will say that she probably is not the best pick due to her bubble being slow (Its pretty easy to doge in laning phase) and her ult has a bit of a wind up (If missed its pretty bad!)

That being said she is truly one my favourite champions. 

I recommend, meta comes and go but if you are really good at a champion it wont really matter about meta to much. Pick a main that you are going to love and enjoy! I have had people call nami op after playing her but  she really isn't. I have honestly played her to much. 

She can be a lot of fun! I do recommend to also have back tank as Nami doesn't also go well into things like bard/zyra. 

Good Luck Summoner!
